titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 3150) to amend title 11 of the United States Code, and for other purposes.

action.text: Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 3150 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit with or without instructions. It shall be in order to consider as an original bill for the purpose of amendment under the five-minute rule the amendment in the nature of a substitute recommended by the Committee on the Judiciary now printed in the bill. Measure will be read by title. Specified amendments are in order.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 105-573, by Mr. Linder.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 205.

action.text: Point of order raised by Mr. Nadler on the content of the measure. Mr. Nadler stated that the resolution violated Sec. 425(a) of the Congressional Budget Act which relates to the Unfunded Mandates Provisions. The Chair ruled that Mr. Nadler's point of order achieved the threshold required under the rule because the language on which the point of order was based was specified by Mr. Nadler within the text of the resolution. The House proceeded with 20 minutes of debate on the point of order which will be followed by a vote on the question of consideration of the resolution.
The House is moving to consider the resolution.
On motion to consider the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 248 - 166 (Roll No. 216).
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 236 - 183 (Roll No. 217).

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 251 - 172 (Roll No. 218).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 6/9/1998--Introduced. Sets forth the rule (modified closed) for the consideration of H.R. 3150 (bankruptcy revisions).
